translation: słabnąć [formal; to become less strong; to make something less strong]
sentence: The storm showed no signs of abating.

translation: narastać, rosnąć [formal; to increase in number or amount over a period of time]
sentence: Interest will accrue on the account at a rate of seven percent.

translation: refleksja [an idea, thought, or plan that was not originally intended but is thought of at a later time]
sentence: The pillars seem to have been added to the entrance as an afterthought.

translation: domniemany, rzekomy [formal; said or thought by some people to be the stated bad or illegal thing, although you have no proof]
sentence: Several alleged drug lords are to be put on trial.

translation: zawieszenie broni [a formal agreement during a war to stop fighting and discuss making peace]
sentence: The armistice was signed on December 4.

translation: wiarygodny, miarodajny [that you can trust and respect as true and correct]
sentence: The book is an authoritative account of the Second World War.

translation: borsuk
sentence: We saw a fairly large black creature with a streak of white - a badger.

translation: barka [a large boat with a flat bottom, used for carrying goods and people on canals and rivers]
sentence: Their canals are excellently constructed, and they can carry heavy barges.

translation: jęczmień
sentence: Farmers in the area grow a wide range of crops but major crops include wheat, barley, and horse beans.

translation: wygrzewać się, wylegiwać na słońcu [to enjoy sitting or lying in the heat or light of something, especially the sun]
sentence: We could see seals on the rocks, basking in the sun.

translation: nieludzki, okropny [informal, old-fashioned; unkind or unpleasant]
sentence: Don't be so beastly to him!

translation: ujrzeć [literary; to see or look at someone or something]
sentence: The new bridge is an incredible sight to behold.

translation: brzoza
sentence: He sat in his short overcoat leaning against a birch tree.

translation: grota, pieczara [a large cave]
sentence: The underground cavern was formed where water used to flow.

translation: źrebak [a young male horse up to the age of four or five]
sentence: Dandy was the first colt born on their ranch.

translation: współistnienie, choroba współistniejąca [the fact that people who have a disease or condition also have one or more other diseases or conditions]
sentence: The study suggests that there may be greater comorbidity between the two conditions than has been acknowledged.

translation: zgadzać się z, być zbieżnym [formal; to agree or have the same opinion]
sentence: The new report concurs with previous findings.

translation: argument, spór [formal; a belief or an opinion that you express, especially in an argument; angry disagreement between people]
sentence: It is our client's contention that the fire was an accident.

translation: przyległy, przylegający, sąsiedni [next to or touching another, usually similar, thing]
sentence: The countries are contiguous.

translation: akrobata, człowiek guma [someone who can twist their body into shapes and positions that normal people cannot]
sentence: Below, a contortionist on a pedestal folded up her costumed body, insect-like and alien.

translation: przymierze, pakt [a promise to someone, or a legal agreement, especially one to pay a regular amount of money to someone or something]
sentence: The contract contained a restrictive covenant against building on the land.

translation: łatwowierność [formal; willingness to believe that something is real or true, especially when this is unlikely]
sentence: The plot of the novel stretches credulity to the limit.

translation: zbity z tropu, zawiedziony, przybity [disappointed and sad because of having failed unexpectedly]
sentence: The crestfallen butcher returned to his shop, and the news spread that he was a fraudulent trader.

translation: dziekan [a person in a university who is in charge of a department of studies]
sentence: Paweł Strzelecki is the dean of the Faculty of Mathematics, Informatics and Mechanics at the University of Warsaw.

translation: cedzić, przelewać [to pour liquid, especially wine, from one container into another]
sentence: Decant the wine and allow it to stand at room temperature for a couple of hours.

translation: zniedołężniały, walący się [in very bad condition because of being old, or not having been cared for, or having been used a lot]
sentence: A decrepit old man sat on a park bench.

translation: odbijać [to change direction or make something change direction, especially after hitting something]
sentence: The ball deflected off my shoulder, straight into the goal.

translation: szkodliwy [formal; harmful and damaging]
sentence: These drugs have a proven deleterious effect on the nervous system.

translation: postawa, aparycja [formal; the way that someone looks, seems, and behaves]
sentence: There was nothing in his demeanor that suggested he was anxious.

translation: pozbawiać, odbierać (prawa) [to take something, especially something necessary or pleasant, away from someone]
sentence: You can't function properly when you're deprived of sleep.

translation: rosa [the very small drops of water that form on the ground, etc. during the night]
sentence: The grass was wet with early morning dew.

translation: opadać, obwisać [to bend, hang, or move downward, especially because of being weak or tired]
sentence: She was so tired, her eyelids were beginning to droop.

translation: euforia, podniecenie [a state of extreme happiness or excitement]
sentence: There's a sense of elation at having completed a race of such length.

translation: czułe słowo [a word or an expression that is used to show affection]
sentence: “Darling” is a term of endearment.

translation: wymawiać, ogłosić [to say or pronounce words clearly; (formal) to express an idea clearly and exactly]
sentence: She enunciated each word slowly and carefully. He enunciated his vision of the future.

translation: mylny, błędny [formal; not correct; based on wrong information]
sentence: He seems to be under the erroneous impression that she is in love with him.

translation: godny szacunku [formal or old-fashioned; deserving respect and admiration]
sentence: I would never doubt the worthy intentions of that estimable gentleman.

translation: uboczny, obcy, nieistotny [not directly connected with the particular situation you are in or the subject you are dealing with]
sentence: We do not want any extraneous information on the page.

translation: wydzielać [to have a lot of a particular quality or feeling; to produce a smell or liquid substance from inside]
sentence: She just exudes confidence. Some trees exude a sap that repels insect parasites.

translation: zdolność, umiejętność, zmysł [any of the physical or mental abilities that a person is born with]
sentence: She retained her mental faculties until the day she died.

translation: afiszować się, obnosić się z [(disapproving) to show something you are proud of to other people, in order to impress them]
sentence: He's got a lot of money but he doesn't flaunt it.

translation: część garderoby [formal; a piece of clothing]
sentence: It was observed that she was tearful when she was asked to take off her lower garments.

translation: przypadkowy, chaotyczny [(disapproving) with no particular order or plan; not organized well]
sentence: The whole examination process seemed completely haphazard.

translation: nieszczęsny, feralny [formal; unlucky and usually unhappy]
sentence: Many children are hapless victims of this war.

translation: kopyto [the hard part of the foot of some animals, for example horses]
sentence: Zinc is important to maintaining the skin and hooves of cattle.

translation: chłonąć, pochłaniać [(formal) to absorb something, especially information; (formal or humorous) to drink something, especially alcohol]
sentence: He imbibed elements of oriental mysticism from the years he spent in India.

translation: niedowierzający [not wanting or not able to believe something, and usually showing this]
sentence: A few incredulous spectators watched on as Paterson, ranked 23rd in the world, beat the champion.

translation: niestrudzony [formal; always determined and energetic in trying to achieve something and never willing to admit defeat]
sentence: Annie was an indefatigable campaigner for better community services.

translation: oburzony [feeling or showing anger and surprise because you think that you have been treated unfairly]
sentence: She was very indignant at the way she had been treated.

translation: pracowity [(approving) working hard; busy]
sentence: She's extremely competent and industrious.

translation: wniosek, wnioskowanie [formal; a guess that you make or an opinion that you form based on the information that you have]
sentence: They were warned to expect a heavy air attack and by inference many casualties.

translation: opanować, atakować [(of animals and insects that carry disease) to cause a problem by being present in large numbers]
sentence: The barn was infested with rats.

translation: poczucie, przypuszczenie [a slight knowledge of something that is happening or about to happen]
sentence: The first inkling I had that something was wrong was when I found the front door wide open.

translation: tęczówka [the round colored part that surrounds the pupil of your eye]
sentence: When you say someone is blue-eyed, you are referring to the color of their irises.

translation: paplać, trajkotać [to talk quickly and in an excited way so that it is difficult to understand what you are saying]
sentence: What is he jabbering about now?

translation: wstrząs, szarpnięcie [a sudden rough movement; a sudden strong feeling, especially of shock or surprise]
sentence: The plane landed with a jolt. The reminder that he was dead gave her a jolt.

translation: niszczycielska siła [(figurative) a large and powerful force or institution that cannot be controlled]
sentence: Health care has turned into something of a juggernaut in the economy recently.

translation: baryłka, beczka [a round wooden or metal container with a flat top and bottom, used especially for storing beer, like a barrel but smaller]
sentence: A keg is usually the easiest way to provide beer to a large group of people.

translation: chwalebny [formal; (of actions and behavior) deserving praise, even if there is little or no success]
sentence: The recycling programme is laudable, but does it save much money?

translation: wycieraczka, mata [a piece of thick material that you put on the floor, often in order to protect it]
sentence: Wipe your feet on the mat before you come in, please.

translation: poturbować [(of an animal) to attack and injure someone by tearing their flesh; to touch someone or something in an unpleasant and/or violent way]
sentence: He was mauled by a lion.

translation: środek, sposób [an action, an object, or a system by which a result is achieved; a way of achieving or doing something]
sentence: Television is an effective means of communication.

translation: południe
sentence: The fog is expected to have cleared away by midday.

translation: wykroczenie [(formal) an action that is bad or unacceptable, but not very serious; (law) a crime that is not considered to be very serious]
sentence: Indeed, larcenies can be designated as a misdemeanor or felony, depending on the state.

translation: linieć [(of a bird or animal) to lose feathers, skin, or hair as a natural process before a new growth of feathers, skin, or hair]
sentence: After three to four months, pups molt to the color of adult females and subadults.

translation: kaganiec [a covering put over an animal's nose and mouth in order to prevent it from biting]
sentence: She asked him to put a muzzle on his dog after it scared her children.

translation: zakątek, kącik [literary; a small quiet place or corner that is sheltered or hidden from other people]
sentence: The black dress she wore fit her like a second skin, outlining every curve, dip and nook of her body.

translation: nieświadomy, niepomny [not conscious of something, especially what is happening around you]
sentence: Absorbed in her work, she was totally oblivious of her surroundings.

translation: sączyć się, wydzielać [to flow slowly out of something through a small opening, or to slowly produce a thick sticky liquid]
sentence: Blood was still oozing out of the wound.

translation: ukłucie, przypływ [a sudden sharp feeling, especially of painful emotion]
sentence: Bernard felt a sharp pang of jealousy. She looked at Susan and saw with a pang how tired and frail she seemed.

translation: szczypce [one of a pair of curved hand-like parts of an animal such as a crab]
sentence: Crabs normally catch food with their pincers.

translation: nadmiar, bogactwo [formal; a very large amount of something, especially a larger amount than you need, want, or can deal with]
sentence: There's a plethora of books about the royal family.

translation: godny pochwały, chlubny [formal]
sentence: His actions during the crisis were truly praiseworthy.

translation: nadprzyrodzony, niezwykły [that does not seem natural; that cannot be explained by natural laws]
sentence: Anger gave me preternatural strength, and I managed to force the door open.

translation: ropa [thick, yellowish liquid that forms in and comes from an infected cut or injury in the body]
sentence: Four patients had pus discharge from the wound.

translation: odwet, represje [a violent or aggressive act toward someone because of something bad that they have done toward you]
sentence: They shot ten hostages in reprisal for the assassination of their leader.

translation: odwołać [formal, law; to make a law, agreement, order, or decision no longer have any (legal) power]
sentence: We urge the committee to rescind its decision.

translation: sprawiedliwy, słuszny, prawy [morally right and good]
sentence: He was regarded as a righteous and holy man.

translation: obręcz, brzeg, krawędź [the outer, often curved or circular, edge of something]
sentence: The rim of the cup was chipped and broken.

translation: żałować, ubolewać [literary; to feel bad about something that happened or something that you did because it had bad results]
sentence: He rued the day they had bought such a large house.

translation: zbawienie [(in Christianity) the state of being saved from the power of evil; a way of protecting someone from danger, disaster, loss, etc.]
sentence: Group therapy classes have been his salvation.

translation: szydzić, naśmiewać się [to laugh and talk about a person or idea in a way that shows that you think they are stupid or silly]
sentence: The critics scoffed at his paintings.

translation: odosobnione [(of a place) quiet and private; not used or disturbed by other people]
sentence: At the restaurant, he led her to a secluded booth and waited until she was seated.

translation: wić się, pełzać [(of bodies) to move easily and quickly across a surface while twisting or curving]
sentence: She watched the snake slither away.

translation: oszczerstwo [an unfair remark about someone or something that may damage other people's opinion of them]
sentence: The crowd started throwing bottles and shouting racial slurs.

translation: ospa prawdziwa, czarna ospa [a serious infectious disease (now extremely rare) that causes fever, leaves permanent marks on the skin, and often causes death]
sentence: The study of immunity cannot be complete without mention of smallpox.

translation: pobyt [literary; a short period when a person stays in a particular place]
sentence: My sojourn in the youth hostel was thankfully short.

translation: rzadki [only present in small amounts or numbers and often spread over a large area]
sentence: Vegetation becomes sparse higher up the mountains.

translation: cętka, plamka [a small colored mark or spot on a background of a different color]
sentence: A blackbird's egg is blue with brown speckles on it.

translation: pyskówka, sprzeczka [to argue noisily about something that is not very important]
sentence: My sisters were squabbling over what to watch on TV.

translation: łodyga [the main stem of a plant, or the narrow stem that joins leaves, flowers, or fruit to the main stem of a plant]
sentence: She trimmed the stalks of the tulips before putting them in a vase.

translation: skrobia [a white substance that exists in large amounts in potatoes and particular grains such as rice]
sentence: Corn starch is used as a thickener in stews.

translation: szpak
sentence: Today, some two hundred million starlings and a further one hundred and fifty million sparrows live there.

translation: zbaczać, zabłąkać [to move away from the place where you should be, without intending to; to start thinking or talking about a different subject from the one you should be giving attention to]
sentence: I suddenly realized that I had strayed far from the village.

translation: nosze [a flat structure covered with cloth which is used to carry someone who is sick or injured]
sentence: She was carried off the track on a stretcher.

translation: sukurs, ratunek [literary; help that you give to someone who is suffering or having problems]
sentence: I humbly ask your pardon, and beg the succor of your prayers.

translation: pokrzyżować, zniweczyć [to prevent someone from doing what they want to do]
sentence: She was thwarted in her attempt to take control of the party.

translation: brzęk, dzwonienie [a light ringing sound]
sentence: In the distance we heard the silvery tinkle of a stream.

translation: kocur [a male cat]
sentence: The school mascot is a tomcat and the school colors are red, white, and gray.

translation: promować, kreować [to advertise, talk about, or praise something or someone repeatedly, especially as a way of encouraging people to like, accept, or buy something]
sentence: He is being widely touted as the next leader of the party.

translation: baryłkowaty [informal; (of a person) fat]
sentence: Our chef was a genial, slightly tubby man.

translation: szpagat, sznurek [strong string made of two or more pieces of string twisted together]
sentence: Ropes and twines are widely employed for marine, agricultural, and general industrial use.

translation: tyran [a ruler who has unlimited power over other people, and uses it unfairly and cruelly]
sentence: Overnight my boss seems to have turned into a tyrant.

translation: niesforny, nieposłuszny [difficult to control or manage]
sentence: He struggled hard to control his unruly emotions.

translation: działania wojenne, wojna [the activity of fighting a war, often including the weapons and methods that are used]
sentence: The debate soon degenerated into open warfare.
